intro: Thibaudia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Thibaudia glandulosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
